title: Isaiah Chapter 32 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Isaiah chapter 32 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Isaiah Chapter 32 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Isaiah Chapter 32.

questions.question: Who shall reign in righteousness according to Isaiah 32:1?
options: A king
A prophet
A priest
A judge
questions.correctAnswer: A king
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:1 states that a king shall reign in righteousness.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:2, what is a man compared to in a dry place?
options: A shadow of a great rock
A blazing fire
A flowing river
A tall mountain
questions.correctAnswer: A shadow of a great rock
questions.explanation: Verse 2 compares a man to the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

questions.question: What will the eyes of those that see and the ears of those that hear do according to Isaiah 32:3?
options: Be dim and closed
Not be dim and will hearken
Be blind and deaf
Look away and ignore
questions.correctAnswer: Not be dim and will hearken
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:3 says the eyes shall not be dim and the ears shall hearken.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:4, what will the heart of the rash do?
options: Understand knowledge
Rebel against wisdom
Remain ignorant
Speak lies
questions.correctAnswer: Understand knowledge
questions.explanation: Verse 4 states that the heart of the rash shall understand knowledge.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32:5 says the vile person will be called liberal.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:5 says the vile person shall be no more called liberal.

questions.question: What kind of devices does the churl devise according to Isaiah 32:7?
options: Wicked devices
Good devices
Peaceful devices
Unwise devices
questions.correctAnswer: Wicked devices
questions.explanation: Verse 7 describes the churl devising wicked devices to destroy the poor.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:8, what kind of things does the liberal devise?
options: Liberal things
Evil things
Unjust things
Foolish things
questions.correctAnswer: Liberal things
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:8 says the liberal deviseth liberal things.

questions.question: Who does Isaiah 32:9 call to rise up and hear his voice?
options: Women that are at ease
Men of the city
The priests
The children
questions.correctAnswer: Women that are at ease
questions.explanation: Verse 9 calls 'ye women that are at ease' to rise up and hear.

questions.question: What will fail according to Isaiah 32:10?
options: The vintage
The rain
The harvest
The rivers
questions.correctAnswer: The vintage
questions.explanation: Verse 10 says the vintage shall fail and the gathering shall not come.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Isaiah 32:12 says they shall lament for the ______, for the pleasant fields, and for the fruitful vine.
options: teats
mountains
rivers
trees
questions.correctAnswer: teats
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:12 mentions lamenting for the teats, pleasant fields, and fruitful vine.

questions.question: What will come up upon the land of God's people according to Isaiah 32:13?
options: Thorns and briers
Flowers and fruits
Rivers and streams
Mountains and hills
questions.correctAnswer: Thorns and briers
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states that thorns and briers shall come up upon the land of God's people.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32:14 says the palaces shall be filled with people and joy.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 14 says the palaces shall be forsaken and the city left desolate.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:15, what will happen when the spirit is poured upon us from on high?
options: The wilderness becomes a fruitful field
The mountains crumble
The city is destroyed
The rivers dry up
questions.correctAnswer: The wilderness becomes a fruitful field
questions.explanation: Verse 15 describes the spirit poured from on high causing the wilderness to become fruitful.

questions.question: What shall dwell in the wilderness according to Isaiah 32:16?
options: Judgment
Fear
Despair
Chaos
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment
questions.explanation: Verse 16 says judgment shall dwell in the wilderness.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32:17 teaches that the work of righteousness leads to peace.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 17 states that the work of righteousness is peace.

medium.title: Isaiah Chapter 32 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Isaiah Chapter 32 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with speaking clearly and understanding God’s truth. Based on Isaiah 32, what biblical truth would you share about spiritual growth?
options: The tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly
The eyes of them that see shall be dim
The heart of the rash will remain ignorant
The ears of them that hear shall ignore wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: The tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:4 teaches that spiritual growth leads to clear speech and understanding. Also, Isaiah 32:3 mentions the eyes shall not be dim and ears shall hearken, emphasizing clarity and discernment.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 32 describe the role of righteous leadership in a community?
options: A king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment
Leaders shall seek personal gain and power
Princes shall ignore justice and mercy
Kings shall be harsh and oppressive
questions.correctAnswer: A king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in judgment
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:1 highlights that godly leadership is characterized by righteousness and just judgment, which is foundational for peace and security in the community (verses 16-18).

questions.question: A believer wants to cultivate generosity and integrity in daily life. What biblical principle from Isaiah 32 can help guide them?
options: The liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand
The vile person is called bountiful
The churl deviseth good plans
The rash are praised for generosity
questions.correctAnswer: The liberal deviseth liberal things; and by liberal things shall he stand
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:8 shows that generosity and wise stewardship are key virtues that establish a person firmly. This contrasts with verse 5-7, where the vile and churl cause harm.

questions.question: What encouragement does Isaiah 32 offer to those enduring hardship and waiting on God's Spirit?
options: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, the wilderness shall be fruitful
The troubles will never end and despair is certain
The city will remain forsaken forever
Judgment will only increase without relief
questions.correctAnswer: Until the spirit be poured upon us from on high, the wilderness shall be fruitful
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:15 encourages believers to wait on God's Spirit for transformation and fruitfulness. This brings peace and righteousness as described in verses 16-18.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with impatience during trials. How does Isaiah 32 teach about perseverance and peace?
options: The work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance forever
Peace comes only after all trials end immediately
Righteousness leads to constant conflict
Assurance is found in wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: The work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance forever
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:17 teaches that righteousness produces lasting peace and assurance, encouraging believers to persevere with faith and integrity (verses 16-18).

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32, what impact does wicked speech and hypocrisy have on the needy and hungry?
options: It makes empty the soul of the hungry and causes the drink of the thirsty to fail
It provides comfort and hope
It strengthens the poor with truth
It encourages generosity and care
questions.correctAnswer: It makes empty the soul of the hungry and causes the drink of the thirsty to fail
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:6 explains how vile and hypocritical speech harms those in need, highlighting the importance of honesty and compassion (verses 5-7).

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32 says that careless and complacent people will be unaffected by difficult times.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:9-11 warns careless women to rise and listen because many days of trouble will come, showing that complacency leads to hardship.

questions.question: How does Isaiah 32 describe God’s provision for those who faithfully sow and work diligently?
options: Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass
The harvest will always fail for the diligent
Those who work hard will be forsaken
Fruitfulness depends solely on luck
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed are ye that sow beside all waters, that send forth thither the feet of the ox and the ass
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:20 affirms that faithful work and stewardship are blessed by God, encouraging diligence and trust in His provision.

questions.question: In Isaiah 32, what is the attitude of the 'vile person' toward generosity and truth?
options: The vile person will speak villany and practice hypocrisy
The vile person is known for kindness and truthfulness
The vile person encourages generosity and justice
The vile person is praised for humility
questions.correctAnswer: The vile person will speak villany and practice hypocrisy
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:5-7 details how the vile person is dishonest and harmful, contrasting with the liberal who devises good things (verse 8).

questions.question: A believer is struggling with fear of future hardships. What passage in Isaiah 32 provides hope about God’s justice and righteousness prevailing?
options: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field
The city will remain full of sorrow forever
The wilderness shall become barren
Justice will be forgotten among the people
questions.correctAnswer: Then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:16 assures that God's justice and righteousness will prevail even in desolate places, giving hope for restoration (verses 15-18).

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32 teaches that peace and quiet resting places are blessings for God’s people after righteousness is established.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:18 describes peaceable habitation and quiet resting places as blessings that come when righteousness and judgment dwell among God’s people.

questions.question: A believer wants to grow in humility and contentment. According to Isaiah 32, what imagery helps remind us of God’s protection and provision?
options: A man shall be as a hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest
A man shall be like a raging storm
A man shall be as a barren desert
A man shall be as a wandering cloud
questions.correctAnswer: A man shall be as a hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the tempest
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:2 uses comforting imagery of protection and provision, encouraging believers to trust God in difficulties (verses 1-3).

questions.question: How does Isaiah 32 instruct believers to respond to spiritual complacency and ease?
options: Rise up and hear the voice; be troubled for careless ways
Remain comfortable and ignore warnings
Ignore the speech of the prophet
Continue in ease without concern
questions.correctAnswer: Rise up and hear the voice; be troubled for careless ways
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:9-11 calls the complacent to awaken and repent, warning that ease without faithfulness leads to trouble and loss.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And the work of righteousness shall be _____; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance forever.'
options: peace
conflict
doubt
fear
questions.correctAnswer: peace
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:17 teaches that righteousness produces peace, quietness, and assurance, emphasizing the blessings of living rightly.

questions.question: A believer is reflecting on integrity at work. According to Isaiah 32, what characterizes those who devise wicked devices?
options: They use lying words to destroy the poor even when the needy speak right
They encourage truth and justice
They help those in need with honesty
They build up the community with generosity
questions.correctAnswer: They use lying words to destroy the poor even when the needy speak right
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:7 warns against deceitful speech and wicked plans that harm vulnerable people, encouraging believers to act with integrity.

hard.title: Isaiah Chapter 32 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Isaiah Chapter 32.

questions.question: In Isaiah 32:1, what type of ruler is prophesied to reign?
options: A king who reigns in righteousness
A king who reigns with power
A tyrant who reigns in fear
A priest who reigns in holiness
questions.correctAnswer: A king who reigns in righteousness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:1 states, 'Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness,' highlighting the ideal ruler characterized by justice, which contrasts with many corrupt rulers in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: Isaiah 32:2 uses several metaphors to describe a man as a refuge. Which of the following is NOT one of them?
options: As rivers of water in a dry place
As the shadow of a great rock in a weary land
As a fortress on a high hill
As a hiding place from the wind and a covert from the tempest
questions.correctAnswer: As a fortress on a high hill
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:2 describes a man as a hiding place from the wind, a covert from the tempest, rivers of water in a dry place, and the shadow of a great rock, but does not mention a fortress on a high hill, a metaphor found elsewhere in biblical texts.

questions.question: What transformation in communication does Isaiah 32:4 predict?
options: The rash will understand knowledge and the stammerers will speak plainly
The silent will become prophets and the deaf will hear clearly
The wise will become silent and the foolish will speak loudly
The languages of nations will be unified
questions.correctAnswer: The rash will understand knowledge and the stammerers will speak plainly
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:4 states that the heart of the rash shall understand knowledge and the tongue of the stammerers shall be ready to speak plainly, indicating a restoration of understanding and clear communication.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:5-7, which of the following describes the behavior of the 'vile person'?
options: He speaks villany and practices hypocrisy
He is generous and kind to the poor
He builds houses of joy in the city
He leads the people in righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: He speaks villany and practices hypocrisy
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:6 describes the vile person as one who speaks villany, practices hypocrisy, and utters error against the LORD, causing harm to the hungry and thirsty.

questions.question: What is the contrast drawn in Isaiah 32:8 between the 'churl' and the 'liberal'?
options: The churl devises wicked devices; the liberal devises liberal things
The churl gives generously; the liberal withholds
The churl is humble; the liberal is proud
Both devise wicked devices
questions.correctAnswer: The churl devises wicked devices; the liberal devises liberal things
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:7-8 contrasts the churl, who devises wicked plans to destroy the poor, with the liberal, who devises generous plans and by them shall stand, emphasizing the moral divide.

questions.question: Isaiah 32:9-11 calls the 'women that are at ease' to rise and hear. What is the significance of this call in the historical context?
options: It is a rebuke of complacency during impending judgment
It is a call to celebrate the harvest
It invites them to participate in the temple rituals
It encourages them to lead the army
questions.correctAnswer: It is a rebuke of complacency during impending judgment
questions.explanation: The passage (Isaiah 32:9-11) admonishes the complacent women who live in ease, warning them of coming troubles and judgment, reflecting the social critique common among prophets addressing Israel's elites.

questions.question: Which literary device is predominantly used in Isaiah 32:12-14 describing the land of the people?
options: Imagery of desolation and abandonment
Allegory of a wedding feast
Chiasm emphasizing joy and celebration
Parable of the sower
questions.correctAnswer: Imagery of desolation and abandonment
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 employ vivid imagery of thorns, briers, forsaken palaces, and deserted cities to depict desolation, a common prophetic motif symbolizing judgment and exile.

questions.question: Isaiah 32:15 speaks of the spirit being poured upon us from on high. How does this foreshadow New Testament themes?
options: It prefigures the outpouring of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost
It foretells the coming of the Messiah as a warrior king
It predicts the destruction of the temple
It references the ascension of Elijah
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures the outpouring of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost
questions.explanation: The pouring out of the spirit from on high in Isaiah 32:15 is often seen as a prophetic foreshadowing of the New Testament event of Pentecost, where the Holy Spirit was given to believers.

questions.question: What is the relationship between 'judgment' and 'righteousness' as stated in Isaiah 32:16?
options: Judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field
Judgment will be harsh, and righteousness will be scarce
Judgment and righteousness will both be removed
Judgment will be delayed until righteousness comes
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness remain in the fruitful field
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:16 expresses a parallelism showing judgment and righteousness inhabiting distinct but related spaces, indicating restoration and order following desolation.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:17, what is the ultimate effect of righteousness?
options: Peace, quietness, and assurance forever
Wealth and prosperity
Power and dominion
Joy and celebration
questions.correctAnswer: Peace, quietness, and assurance forever
questions.explanation: Verse 17 states that the work of righteousness leads to peace, and its effect is quietness and assurance forever, emphasizing the lasting tranquility brought by justice.

questions.question: Isaiah 32:18 describes the condition of God's people when righteousness prevails. Which of the following best captures this state?
options: Dwelling in peaceable habitation, sure dwellings, and quiet resting places
Living in fortified cities with strong walls
Traveling perpetually through the wilderness
Engaged in constant warfare
questions.correctAnswer: Dwelling in peaceable habitation, sure dwellings, and quiet resting places
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:18 depicts the people living in peace and security, a contrast to the earlier desolation imagery, symbolizing restoration and divine blessing.

questions.question: Isaiah 32:19 mentions hail coming down on the forest and the city being low. What is the likely symbolic meaning of this imagery?
options: Judgment and humbling of the city and nature
A celebration of the harvest season
A call for military retreat
An allegory for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment and humbling of the city and nature
questions.explanation: The hail and the city being low in a low place in Isaiah 32:19 symbolize divine judgment and the humbling of pride, common prophetic motifs illustrating downfall.

questions.question: What blessing is pronounced in Isaiah 32:20?
options: Blessed are those who sow beside all waters
Blessed are the mighty warriors
Blessed are the kings who rule with justice
Blessed are the priests who offer sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed are those who sow beside all waters
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:20 blesses those who sow beside all waters, an image of abundant provision and fruitful labor in a restored land.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32:3 foretells that the eyes of those who see will grow dim and the ears of those who hear will be closed.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:3 states that the eyes of those who see shall not be dim and the ears of those who hear shall hearken, indicating clarity and attentiveness, not dimness or closure.

questions.question: True or False: Isaiah 32:10-11 describes a joyful celebration for the women who are at ease.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:10-11 warns the women at ease that many days and years of trouble are coming, calling them to lament and put on sackcloth, which is a sign of mourning, not celebration.

theological.title: Isaiah Chapter 32 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Isaiah Chapter 32 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:1, what are the qualities of the king and princes who shall reign and rule?
options: Righteousness and judgment
Might and power
Wisdom and wealth
Mercy and forgiveness
questions.correctAnswer: Righteousness and judgment
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:1 states the king shall reign in righteousness and princes shall rule in judgment, highlighting the divine standard of justice. This is consistent with Psalm 72:1-2, Proverbs 29:4, Romans 14:17, and Revelation 19:11 where righteous rule and judgment are emphasized.

questions.question: In Isaiah 32:2, the man is compared to which of the following as a symbol of protection and provision?
options: A hiding place from the wind
A roaring lion in the jungle
A burning fire in the night
A towering mountain peak
questions.correctAnswer: A hiding place from the wind
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:2 uses imagery like a hiding place from the wind, a covert from the tempest, rivers in a dry place, and shadow of a great rock to symbolize protection and provision. Similarly, Psalm 46:1-3 and Psalm 91:1-2 use God as a refuge and shelter.

questions.question: What transformation is described in Isaiah 32:3 regarding the senses of people?
options: Eyes shall not be dim and ears shall hearken
Eyes shall be closed and ears shall be deaf
Eyes shall cry and ears shall be silent
Eyes shall wander and ears shall be dull
questions.correctAnswer: Eyes shall not be dim and ears shall hearken
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:3 promises restored spiritual and physical perception—eyes not dim and ears attentive. This is echoed in Isaiah 35:5-6, John 9:25, and Revelation 3:18 describing spiritual awakening and healing.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:4, what change occurs in the heart and tongue of people?
options: The rash will understand knowledge and the stammerers will speak plainly
The proud will boast and the silent will remain mute
The fearful will flee and the strong will be silent
The wise will remain quiet and the foolish will speak loudly
questions.correctAnswer: The rash will understand knowledge and the stammerers will speak plainly
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:4 shows a transformation where even the rash gain understanding and those who stammer speak clearly. This reflects God's work in renewing minds and tongues, similar to Acts 2:4 and 1 Corinthians 14:9.

questions.question: Who will no longer be called 'liberal' or 'bountiful' according to Isaiah 32:5?
options: The vile person and the churl
The righteous and the meek
The wealthy and the proud
The foreigner and the stranger
questions.correctAnswer: The vile person and the churl
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:5 condemns those who are vile and churlish, indicating they will no longer be praised as liberal or bountiful, reflecting God’s judgment on hypocrisy. This aligns with Proverbs 21:27, Isaiah 5:20, and Matthew 23:27-28 on false appearances.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:6, what are the actions of the vile person?
options: Speak villany, work iniquity, practice hypocrisy, and utter error against the LORD
Show kindness, seek justice, and honor God
Build homes, gather harvest, and bless the poor
Sing praises, teach truth, and feed the hungry
questions.correctAnswer: Speak villany, work iniquity, practice hypocrisy, and utter error against the LORD
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:6 describes the vile person’s corrupt actions including speaking evil, doing iniquity, hypocrisy, and blasphemy, which harm the needy. This is consistent with Psalm 10:7, Jeremiah 6:13, and Romans 1:29 on sinful behavior.

questions.question: What wicked devices does the churl devise according to Isaiah 32:7?
options: To destroy the poor with lying words
To build temples of worship
To give generously to the needy
To bring peace among nations
questions.correctAnswer: To destroy the poor with lying words
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:7 condemns the churl’s evil schemes to destroy the poor through lies, showing injustice and exploitation. This matches Proverbs 6:16-19 and Micah 2:1-2 condemning oppression of the poor.

questions.question: Who is described as devising liberal things and standing by them in Isaiah 32:8?
options: The liberal person
The churl
The prophet
The king
questions.correctAnswer: The liberal person
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:8 praises the liberal person who plans generous deeds and stands firm by them, reflecting true generosity. This echoes Proverbs 11:25, 2 Corinthians 9:6-7, and Luke 6:38 on godly generosity.

questions.question: In Isaiah 32:9-10, who is called to rise up and hear the voice?
options: Women that are at ease and careless daughters
Kings and princes
Prophets and priests
The poor and needy
questions.correctAnswer: Women that are at ease and careless daughters
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:9-10 calls women who are complacent and careless to listen and prepare for coming troubles, symbolizing spiritual complacency. This theme appears in Luke 21:34-36 and 1 Corinthians 10:12 about watchfulness.

questions.question: What calamity is described in Isaiah 32:13-14 regarding the land and city?
options: Thorns and briers will grow, palaces forsaken, forts become dens
Rivers will overflow and cities prosper
Harvest will be abundant and joy will increase
Enemies will be defeated and peace established
questions.correctAnswer: Thorns and briers will grow, palaces forsaken, forts become dens
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:13-14 depicts desolation: thorns over the land, palaces abandoned, and forts turned into dens, reflecting judgment. Similar imagery is found in Jeremiah 9:11, Ezekiel 6:13, and Hosea 9:6.

questions.question: According to Isaiah 32:15, what will happen when the spirit is poured from on high?
options: The wilderness will become a fruitful field
The mountains will crumble
The seas will dry up
The sun will cease to shine
questions.correctAnswer: The wilderness will become a fruitful field
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:15 promises that when the Spirit is poured out, desolate places become fruitful, indicating restoration through the Holy Spirit. This is echoed in Joel 2:28-29, Ezekiel 36:26-27, and Acts 2:17.

questions.question: What does Isaiah 32:16 say will dwell in the wilderness and remain in the fruitful field?
options: Judgment and righteousness
War and destruction
Darkness and despair
Chaos and confusion
questions.correctAnswer: Judgment and righteousness
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:16 states judgment will dwell in the wilderness and righteousness remain in the fruitful field, symbolizing divine justice and blessing. This aligns with Psalm 85:10, Romans 14:17, and 2 Corinthians 5:21.

questions.question: What is the work and effect of righteousness according to Isaiah 32:17?
options: Peace, quietness, and assurance forever
Wealth, power, and fame
Fear, trembling, and judgment
Sorrow, hardship, and exile
questions.correctAnswer: Peace, quietness, and assurance forever
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:17 teaches that righteousness results in lasting peace and assurance, reflecting God’s kingdom values. This is consistent with Isaiah 9:6, John 14:27, Romans 5:1, and Philippians 4:7.

questions.question: Where will God’s people dwell according to Isaiah 32:18?
options: In peaceable habitation, sure dwellings, and quiet resting places
In tents of sorrow and places of exile
In battlefields and cities of destruction
In uncertain homes and fearful places
questions.correctAnswer: In peaceable habitation, sure dwellings, and quiet resting places
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:18 promises God’s people will dwell in safety and peace, a theme consistent with Psalm 23:4, Proverbs 3:33, and Hebrews 4:9-11 regarding divine protection and rest.

questions.question: What natural phenomenon is mentioned in Isaiah 32:19 and what is its effect on the city?
options: Hail coming down on the forest; the city shall be low in a low place
Floods overflowing the river; the city shall be lifted on high
Fire burning the fields; the city shall be strong and tall
Wind blowing gently; the city shall flourish
questions.correctAnswer: Hail coming down on the forest; the city shall be low in a low place
questions.explanation: Isaiah 32:19 describes hail descending on the forest and the city being humbled, symbolizing judgment and desolation. Similar imagery is found in Exodus 9:23-25 and Revelation 8:7.
